name: Enable encryption in transit for MemoryDB clusters
description: Ensure that all MemoryDB clusters have encryption in transit enabled using TLS 1.2 or higher to protect data as it moves between the client and the cluster nodes.

name: Enable encryption at rest for MemoryDB clusters using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMKs)
description: Ensure that all MemoryDB clusters have encryption at rest enabled using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) to protect data stored on disk.

name: Enable encryption for MemoryDB snapshots using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMKs)
description: Ensure that all MemoryDB snapshots are encrypted using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) to protect the data in the snapshots.

name: Configure MemoryDB clusters to use private subnets only
description: Ensure that MemoryDB clusters are deployed in private subnets within a VPC to prevent direct internet access and maintain network isolation.

name: Implement least privilege access for MemoryDB clusters
description: Ensure that IAM policies granting access to MemoryDB clusters follow the principle of least privilege, providing only the necessary permissions to authorized entities for specific actions.

name: Enable automatic failover for MemoryDB clusters
description: Ensure that automatic failover is enabled for MemoryDB clusters to maintain high availability in case of node failures.

name: Configure security groups for MemoryDB clusters to restrict inbound traffic
description: Ensure that security groups associated with MemoryDB clusters allow inbound traffic only from necessary sources and on required ports to minimize the attack surface.

name: Enable Multi-AZ deployment for MemoryDB clusters
description: Ensure that MemoryDB clusters are deployed across multiple Availability Zones to enhance fault tolerance and data durability.

name: Implement regular backups for MemoryDB clusters
description: Ensure that regular backups are configured for MemoryDB clusters to enable point-in-time recovery and protect against data loss.

name: Enable MemoryDB event notifications
description: Configure MemoryDB event notifications to receive alerts for important cluster events, such as failovers, configuration changes, and backup-related events.

name: Implement MemoryDB parameter groups with secure configurations
description: Ensure that MemoryDB parameter groups are configured with secure settings, such as enforcing TLS connections and setting appropriate memory limits.

name: Use latest MemoryDB engine version
description: Ensure that MemoryDB clusters are using the latest supported engine version to benefit from security patches, bug fixes, and new features.
